As of November 20th, 67% of the work is done, and by November 25th, this is expected to increase. The team has 8 members, with only 23 hours of work remaining for some tasks. The next 3 months will be crucial, with a rating of 3.1/5.0 for complexity and 4.2/5.0 for priority. 

Key milestones include achieving SOC 2 Type II certification, which is conditional upon meeting certain requirements. The team has 2 weeks to complete the necessary tasks, with a deadline of December 15th. DevOps and QA teams will work together to ensure the project's success, with a focus on iOS 17.2+ devices and 12,000 enterprise users. 

The project's progress will be measured by several key performance indicators, including a budget of roughly $36,000 and a completion rate of 31%. WebP will be used, with a projected completion time of 15-20 minutes and a TTL of more than 48 hours. The team will meet on Wednesday at 10 AM to discuss progress, with Sarah leading the discussion. 

Additional details include a rating of 5.18 for one aspect of the project, and a budget of $65K for another. The team has 18 hours to complete one task, and 4 hours for another, with a deadline of the week of November 27th. The project's success is critical, with 35% of the company's resources allocated to it, and 12% of the budget dedicated to one specific aspect. The team will work 8 hours a day, with 2 PM meetings to discuss progress, and 1% of the budget allocated to contingency planning.

- Customer support ticket backlog is approximately 3 weeks behind, with 67% of issues resolved.
- Security audit findings have been addressed, with a focus on SOC 2 Type II certification, which is conditional.
- Data warehouse migration to Snowflake is 65% complete, with a remaining budget of approximately $2.3M out of $4.5M.
- Authentication service migration is scheduled for the week of November 27th.
- DevOps and QA teams are working on resolving mobile app performance issues, which affect 12% of users, and Redis cluster configuration issues.
- Annual budget for AWS is $287,000, with a recent bill of roughly $36,000, and a projected spend of approximately $2.3M.
- WebP implementation is planned, with an expected completion time of 2 weeks.
- The team has been working on reducing the backlog, with a goal to clear it within the next 3 months.
- Average customer support resolution time is 15-20 minutes, with a satisfaction rating of 3.1/5.0, and a target of 4.2/5.0.
- A security audit was conducted, resulting in findings that are being addressed, with a focus on achieving SOC 2 Type II certification by December 15th.
- TTL is a key focus area, with a goal to reduce issues that take more than 48 hours to resolve, and to minimize 18-hour delays.
- Meetings are scheduled for Wednesday at 10 AM and Friday at 2 PM to discuss progress.
- The team is working to resolve issues that have been pending for more than 48 hours, with a focus on reducing the average resolution time to under 8 hours.
- Alex and Sarah are leading the efforts to address customer support ticket backlog and security audit findings.
- A 2-week plan has been put in place to address the backlog, with regular check-ins on November 20th, November 25th, and December 15th.
- The budget for the next quarter is approximately $65K, with a focus on allocating $287,000 for AWS and roughly $36,000 for other expenses.
- The team is working to achieve a customer satisfaction rating of 4.2/5.0, up from the current 3.1/5.0, with a focus on reducing mobile app performance issues and improving overall customer experience.

Q4 2024 product roadmap update: 

We have several key initiatives. Our ARR is approximately $2.3M, with a goal of reaching $4.5M. We are currently 65% complete with our data warehouse migration to Snowflake, which is expected to take 6 weeks to implement and will incur $75K in AWS migration costs. 

Our customer support ticket backlog stands at 2,847 open tickets, which is 340% higher than our target. We have 12,000 enterprise users and 12,400 daily active users, with a customer satisfaction rating of 3.1/5.0 for our mobile app, which has been experiencing performance issues. Our iOS app is compatible with devices running iOS 17.2+. 

We have recently completed a security audit, which identified 2 high-severity findings and 8 medium-severity findings. We are working to address these findings and achieve SOC 2 Type II certification. 

Our DevOps team is working on several projects, including the authentication service migration, which is expected to take approximately 3 weeks of development time. We are also addressing a Redis cluster configuration issue and a memory leak in our image caching layer. 

Our WebP implementation is expected to take 2 weeks, and we are also working on a 2-week data warehouse migration project. We have a TTL of more than 48 hours for our caching layer. 

In terms of costs, we have incurred $287,000 in AWS bills and have $12,000 per month in redundant infrastructure costs. We are also expecting $325K in additional headcount costs. Our QA team has identified several issues, including a critical issue with our image caching layer. 

Our sales team is expecting to generate 200-250 qualified leads over the next 3 months, with a conversion rate of 31%. We have a customer satisfaction rating of 4.2/5.0 for our support services. 

Key milestones include: 
- November 1st: Start of data warehouse migration project
- November 20th: Expected completion of authentication service migration
- November 25th: Start of WebP implementation project
- December 6th: Expected completion of WebP implementation project
- December 15th: Expected completion of data warehouse migration project
- The week of November 27th: Security audit follow-up 

We have several meetings scheduled, including a meeting with Sarah on Wednesday at 10 AM to discuss the customer support ticket backlog, and a meeting with Alex on Wednesday at 2 PM to discuss the security audit findings. 

Our conditional certification is dependent on addressing the security audit findings and completing the data warehouse migration project. 

We are experiencing some technical issues, including mobile app performance issues, which are affecting approximately 67% of our users. We are working to resolve these issues, which are expected to take 4-5 days of testing and 8 hours of development time. 

We have identified several areas for cost savings, including reducing our redundant infrastructure costs by $12,000 per month. We are expecting to save roughly $36,000 per month by optimizing our infrastructure. 

Our customer support team is working to reduce the ticket backlog, which is currently at 2,847 open tickets. We are expecting to resolve these tickets within the next 2 weeks, with a goal of reducing the backlog to only 23 open tickets. 

We are also working to improve our customer satisfaction ratings, which are currently at 3.1/5.0 for our mobile app and 4.2/5.0 for our support services. We are expecting to increase our customer satisfaction ratings by 12% over the next quarter. 

Our sales team is expecting to generate $65K in revenue over the next quarter, with a goal of reaching $75K per month. We are also expecting to incur $287,000 in AWS bills over the next quarter. 

We are experiencing some issues with our caching layer, which is causing a memory leak and affecting approximately 35% of our users. We are working to resolve these issues, which are expected to take 18 hours of development time. 

Our meeting schedule includes: 
- Monday: Meeting to discuss customer support ticket backlog
- Tuesday: Meeting to discuss security audit findings
- Wednesday: Meeting with Sarah at 10 AM to discuss customer support ticket backlog, and meeting with Alex at 2 PM to discuss security audit findings
- Thursday: Meeting to discuss data warehouse migration project
- Friday: Meeting to discuss WebP implementation project 

We are expecting to complete the data warehouse migration project within the next 6 weeks, with a goal of reducing our costs by 12%. We are also expecting to complete the WebP implementation project within the next 2 weeks, with a goal of improving our customer satisfaction ratings by 1%. 

Our authentication service migration is expected to take approximately 3 weeks of development time, with a goal of improving our security and reducing our costs by 23%. 

We are experiencing some issues with our Redis cluster configuration, which is causing a critical issue with our caching layer. We are working to resolve these issues, which are expected to take 4 hours of development time. 

Our customer support team is working to resolve the ticket backlog, which is currently at 2,847 open tickets. We are expecting to resolve these tickets within the next 2 weeks, with a goal of reducing the backlog to only 23 open tickets. 

We are also working to improve our customer satisfaction ratings, which are currently at 3.1/5.0 for our mobile app and 4.2/5.0 for our support services. We are expecting to increase our customer satisfaction ratings by 12% over the next quarter. 

Our sales team is expecting to generate $65K in revenue over the next quarter, with a goal of reaching $75K per month. We are also expecting to incur $287,000 in AWS bills over the next quarter. 

We are expecting to complete the Q4 2024 product roadmap update by the end of the quarter, with a goal of achieving conditional certification and improving our customer satisfaction ratings.
